item.title: Tech war: China chip imports fall in 2023 but semiconductors remain country’s largest item ahead of crude oil
item.description:
Summary：

China's imports of integrated circuits (IC) declined in 2023 in terms of both volume and value, despite remaining the country's largest import item ahead of crude oil. This drop reflects economic headwinds and ongoing efforts to promote domestic chip production and reduce reliance on imports. The United States' export control measures, including restrictions on advanced chips, have also contributed to this trend.
  • Abstract: China's chip imports fell in 2023 due to economic challenges and domestic production efforts.
  • Theme: China's efforts to boost domestic chip production and reduce reliance on imported chips, amidst economic headwinds and US export control measures.
  • Viewpoint: The impact of US export controls on China's chip industry; the potential of China's domestic chip production efforts.
  • Main information: Decline in China's IC imports in 2023; China's increased focus on local chip production; US export control measures targeting advanced chips.

总结：

中国进口集成电路（IC）在 2023 年無論是数量还是价值都有所下降，尽管它仍然是中国最大的进口项目，超过原油。这种下降反映了经济阻力以及正在进行的促进国产芯片生产和减少对进口依赖的努力。包括对先进芯片的限制在内的美国的出口管制措施也促成了这一趋势。
  • 摘要：由于经济挑战和国内生产努力，中国芯片进口在 2023 年下降。
  • 主题：中国在经济阻力和美国出口管制措施中努力提升国内芯片生产并减少对进口芯片的依赖。
  • 观点：美国出口管制对中国芯片行业的影响；中国国产芯片生产努力的潜力。
  • 主要信息：2023 年中国 IC 进口下降；中国加大了对本地芯片生产的关注；针对先进芯片的美国出口管制措施。

单词：

  • semiconductors (n.) - /ˈsɛmɪˌkʌnˈdʌktərz/ 半导体。

    原文例句：China’s imports of integrated circuits (IC) plunged by both volume and value in 2023, although semiconductors remained the mainland’s largest import item ahead of crude oil.

    例句讲解：semiconductors 是“半导体”的意思，它是一种能够导电，但导电性介于导体和绝缘体之间的材料。半导体在电子工业中有着广泛的应用，包括集成电路、二极管、晶体管等。

词组：

  • economic headwinds (n.) - 经济逆风，经济阻力。

    原文例句：China chip imports fall in 2023 on economic headwinds and localisation efforts.

    例句讲解：economic headwinds 是“经济阻力”的意思，它指经济发展中遇到的困难或挑战。这些困难或挑战可能来自内部或外部，包括经济衰退、通货膨胀、高失业率、贸易逆差等。

句子：

  • China is making solid progress in boosting local output of legacy chips, including those being used in cars and home appliances, to satisfy domestic demand.- 中国在提高本地传统芯片的产量方面取得了坚实进展，包括那些用于汽车和家电的芯片，以满足国内需求。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是China is making solid progress，其中主语是China，谓语是is making solid progress，宾语是progress。in boosting local output of legacy chips, including those being used in cars and home appliances, to satisfy domestic demand是一个现在分词短语作状语，表示中国在提高本地传统芯片的产量方面取得了坚实进展的原因或目的，即为了满足国内需求。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：China is unable to directly buy advanced chips, such as the H100 and A100 graphics processing units designed by US-based Nvidia.

    语法讲解：这是一个常见的时态，结构是：have/has + been + 过去分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，过去分词是动词的-ed或-en形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，it表示中国从过去的某个时间开始一直持续到现在都无法直接购买先进芯片，动作或状态持续性尚未完成。

  • In 2023, China imported a total of 479.5 billion IC units worth US$349.4 billion
  • Under rigid US export measures, China is unable to directly purchase advanced chips such as Nvidia’s H100 and A100 GPUs

China’s imports of integrated circuits (IC) plunged by both volume and value in 2023, although semiconductors remained the mainland’s largest import item ahead of crude oil, according to customs data released on Friday.

In 2023, China imported a total of 479.5 billion IC units worth US$349.4 billion, down 10.8 per cent by volume and 15.4 per cent in value from 2022, official data showed. By comparison, the country spent US$337.5 billion importing crude oil last year, a fall of 7.7 per cent.

The weaker imports of ICs and semiconductor devices reflect economic headwinds in the world’s second-largest economy last year, in particular China’s weak smartphone and laptop sales. Meanwhile, the data was also affected by China’s efforts to boost local output to cut reliance on imported chips.

Nvidia reveals progress in China’s self-driving chip market as competition revs up

Under rigid US export control measures, China is unable to directly buy advanced chips, such as the H100 and A100 graphics processing units designed by US-based Nvidia. However, the country is making solid progress in boosting local output of legacy chips, including those being used in cars and home appliances, to satisfy domestic demand.

According to the customs data, China’s imports of diodes and similar semiconductor devices, a proxy of garden-variety commodity chips, were also down by 23.8 per cent in volume terms last year.

The US intensified its export controls on China in October 2022, which caused widespread disruption for global fabless and semiconductor tools companies in their China-related businesses. In October last year, the US further tightened the noose, cutting China’s access to workaround chips that Nvidia had tailor-made for mainland customers.

In a state-backed drive to build a more resilient domestic chip supply chain, China’s semiconductor players have upped their localisation efforts with closer cooperation between the biggest companies. These efforts may also have contributed to the decline of imported chips as China added mature capacity to enable production of the vast majority of chips locally.

China currently has 44 semiconductor wafer fabs in operation and a further 22 under construction, Taiwan-based IC research company TrendForce said in a recent note. By the end of 2024, the capacity for mature chip production – defined as 28-nanometre and older technologies – will be expanded at 32 Chinese fabs.

The massive expansion, which has caused alarm in the US and EU, will see China’s global share of mature process capacity reach 39 per cent by 2027, up from 31 per cent in 2023, with room for further growth if equipment procurement proceeds smoothly, the TrendForce note said.

item.title: Tencent’s e-commerce drive takes off in 2023 on the back of super app WeChat’s short video and live streaming function
item.description:
Summary：

  • WeChat's short video and live streaming feature, Channels, saw remarkable growth in 2023, driven by the popularity of its TikTok-like short video function.
  • The platform recorded nearly triple gross merchandise volume (GMV) in 2023, with the number of orders made through WeChat's video function - Channels - increasing by over 244% year-on-year.
  • WeChat Channels has become a major contributor to Tencent's advertising business, which witnessed a 20% year-on-year growth in the third quarter.

总结：

  • 微信短视频和直播功能频道在2023年取得了显着增长，这得益于其类似TikTok的短视频功能的流行。
  • 该平台在2023年记录的商品交易总额（GMV）几乎增长了两倍，通过微信视频功能（频道）下的订单数量比去年同期增长了244%以上。
  • 微信频道已成为腾讯广告业务的主要贡献者，该业务在第三季度同比增长20%。

单词：

  • gross merchandise volume (GMV) - (名词) 商品交易总额。

    原文例句：WeChat’s short video and live streaming function enabled the platform to record nearly triple gross merchandise volume (GMV) in 2023, according to information released on Thursday during the app’s annual Open Class Pro developer conference held in Guangzhou, capital of southern Guangdong province.

    例句讲解：GMV是指在一定时期内，一个电子商务平台上所有商品的销售总额，不包括运费和税款等费用。在这个例句中，它指的是微信短视频和直播功能在2023年的商品交易总额增长了近3倍。

  • inroads (名词) - 侵入，渗透。

    原文例句：The progress of WeChat Channels has been closely watched in China’s internet industry, as Tencent quietly made inroads into the live-streaming e-commerce market.

    例句讲解：inroads是指逐步渗透或进入一个新的市场或领域。在这个例句中，它指的是腾讯悄悄地进入直播电商市场。

  • swiftly (副词) - 迅速地，很快地。

    原文例句：Tencent also plans to expand its live-streaming e-commerce-related headcount and broaden its product categories, as the WeChat Pay team builds the vital transaction infrastructure to facilitate online payments, according to the LatePost report.

    例句讲解：swiftly是指快速、迅速地进行某个动作或过程。在这个例句中，它指的是腾讯计划迅速扩大其与直播电商相关的员工人数并拓宽其产品品类。

词组：

  • on the back of - 依靠，借助。

    原文例句：Tencent has bet on swiftly building its online retail business on the back of the country’s vast number of WeChat users, estimated at 1.34 billion.

    例句讲解：on the back of是指依靠、借助某个因素或条件。在这个例句中，它指的是腾讯押注于依靠中国庞大的微信用户数量来快速建立其在线零售业务。

句子：

  • WeChat’s short video and live streaming function enabled the platform to record nearly triple gross merchandise volume (GMV) in 2023, according to information released on Thursday during the app’s annual Open Class Pro developer conference held in Guangzhou, capital of southern Guangdong province. - 根据周四在广州举行的该应用程序年度开放课程专业开发者大会上发布的信息，微信的短视频和直播功能使该平台在 2023 年记录的商品交易总额 (GMV) 几乎增长了两倍，广州是广东南部省会。

    • 句子分析：这是一个长句，主句是WeChat’s short video and live streaming function enabled the platform to record nearly triple gross merchandise volume (GMV) in 2023，其中主语是WeChat’s short video and live streaming function，谓语是enabled，宾语是the platform to record nearly triple gross merchandise volume (GMV) in 2023。according to information released on Thursday during the app’s annual Open Class Pro developer conference held in Guangzhou, capital of southern Guangdong province是一个介词短语作状语，修饰enabled，表示根据周四在广州举行的该应用程序年度开放课程专业开发者大会上发布的信息。这个句子的意思是说，根据周四在广州举行的该应用程序年度开放课程专业开发者大会上发布的信息，微信的短视频和直播功能使该平台在 2023 年记录的商品交易总额 (GMV) 几乎增长了两倍。

语法：

  • 现在完成式 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Tencent Holdings, China’s video gaming and social media giant, saw its ubiquitous super app WeChat achieve significant growth in its live-streaming e-commerce business last year, thanks to the popularity of its TikTok-style short video function.

    语法讲解：现在完成式是由have/has和过去分词构成的，表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。在这个例句中，saw表示从去年开始到现在一直持续的看到或观察到的动作，achieve表示从去年开始到现在一直持续的达到或实现的目标。

  • 被动语态 - 表示强调动作或状态的承受者。

    原文例句：WeChat’s short video and live streaming function enabled the platform to record nearly triple gross merchandise volume (GMV) in 2023, according to information released on Thursday during the app’s annual Open Class Pro developer conference held in Guangzhou, capital of southern Guangdong province.

    语法讲解：被动语态是由be和过去分词构成的，表示强调动作或状态的承受者。在这个例句中，enabled是be和过去分词enabled构成的被动语态，表示平台能够记录近三倍的GMV是由微信的短视频和直播功能实现的。

  • Online orders made through WeChat’s short video and live streaming function, Channels, grew more than 244 per cent in 2023 over the previous year
  • WeChat Channels has also become a major driver of Tencent’s advertising business, which grew 20 per cent year on year in the third quarter

Tencent Holdings, China’s video gaming and social media giant, saw its ubiquitous super app WeChat achieve significant growth in its live-streaming e-commerce business last year, thanks to the popularity of its TikTok-style short video function.

WeChat’s short video and live streaming function enabled the platform to record nearly triple gross merchandise volume (GMV) in 2023, according to information released on Thursday during the app’s annual Open Class Pro developer conference held in Guangzhou, capital of southern Guangdong province.

While the platform’s exact GMV figures were not released, conference attendees were told that the number of orders made through WeChat’s video function – marketed as Channels – grew more than 244 per cent in 2023 over the previous year, according to a report by Chinese online media outlet Thepaper.cn.

A number of attendees at the conference, which was held as a closed-door event exclusive to industry partners, on Friday confirmed the reported growth rate. Tencent did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

WeChat’s high GMV performance last year showed how prescient Tencent founder, chairman and chief executive Pony Ma Huateng was in December 2022, when he told an internal town hall meeting that short video was key to the company’s future.

The progress of WeChat Channels has been closely watched in China’s internet industry, as Tencent quietly made inroads into the live-streaming e-commerce market to take on ByteDance-owned Douyin and Kuaishou Technology – the country’s two largest short video platforms.

Tencent was expected to hit 100 billion yuan (US$13.9 billion) in e-commerce GMV, a measure of the total value of goods sold online, through WeChat Channels last year, according to a report last month by Chinese media outlet LatePost.

While the e-commerce turnover on WeChat Channels is small compared with those of Kuaishou and TikTok’s Chinese sibling Douyin, Tencent has bet on swiftly building its online retail business on the back of the country’s vast number of WeChat users, estimated at 1.34 billion.

Tencent also plans to expand its live-streaming e-commerce-related headcount and broaden its product categories, as the WeChat Pay team builds the vital transaction infrastructure to facilitate online payments, according to the LatePost report.

WeChat Channels has already become a major driver of Tencent’s advertising business, which increased 20 per cent year on year in the third quarter, the fastest growth achieved by all of the company’s business segments in that period. During the second quarter, WeChat Channels raked in 3 billion yuan (US$421 million) in advertising revenue.

Launched in 2020, Channels has been growing rapidly and had about 813 million active users as of June 2022. That number was ahead of Douyin’s 680 million users and the 390 million on Kuaishou, according to estimates by Chinese data analytics firm QuestMobile.

item.title: Tesla cuts prices in China on Model 3 and Model Y EVs to keep commanding lead in premium segment of fast-growing market
item.description:
Summary：

Tesla has cut the prices of its Shanghai-made vehicles by up to 6%, aiming to maintain its leading position in China's premium electric vehicle (EV) market. Facing strong competition from Chinese home-grown rivals like Li Auto, Xpeng, and BYD, Tesla is looking to sustain its market share. Despite a 15.7% month-on-month sales growth in December, the overall growth rate in 2023 was similar to that of 2022, and sales growth in China is projected to slow in 2024. Other EV makers like BYD and Xpeng have also resorted to price cuts to attract customers.
  • Abstract: Tesla reduces prices in China amidst rising competition from domestic EV brands.
  • Theme: Tesla's price cuts in China, reflecting the intensifying competition in the premium EV market.
  • Viewpoint: The importance of maintaining market share in the highly competitive Chinese EV space.
  • Main information: Tesla's price cuts across its Model 3 and Model Y range, the growth in sales in China, and the overall trends and challenges in the Chinese EV market.

总结：

特斯拉下调了其在上海制造的汽车的价格，最高降幅达 6%，旨在维持其在中国高级电动汽车 (EV) 市场上的领先地位。面对来自李汽车、小鹏和比亚迪等中国本土对手的强烈竞争，特斯拉正寻求维持其市场份额。尽管 12 月销量环比增长 15.7%，但 2023 年的整体增长速度与 2022 年相似，预计 2024 年中国销量增长将放缓。其他电动汽车制造商，如比亚迪和小鹏，也已采取降价措施以吸引消费者。
  • 摘要：特斯拉在中国降价，以应对来自本土电动汽车品牌的日益激烈的竞争。
  • 主题：特斯拉在中国降价，反映了高级电动汽车市场竞争日益激烈。
  • 观点：在竞争激烈的中国电动汽车领域维持市场份额的重要性。
  • 主要信息：特斯拉在其 Model 3 和 Model Y 车型中全线降价，中国销量增长，以及中国电动汽车市场的整体趋势和挑战。

单词：

  • rival (n.) - /ˈraɪvəl/ 对手，竞争对手。

    原文例句：Tesla apparently hopes to maintain its market share in the highly competitive market,” said Phate Zhang, founder of Shanghai-based EV data provider CnEVPost. “Chinese home-grown rivals have launched a raft of new intelligent electric cars to mount a challenge to the US EV builder.”

    例句讲解：rival 表示“对手、竞争对手”，通常用于竞争或对抗的情况下。在这个例句中，rival 指的是特斯拉的竞争对手，主要是中国本土的电动汽车制造商，如比亚迪、小鹏等。

  • spearhead (v.) - /ˈspɪərˌhɛd/ 带头，领导。

    原文例句：Intensifying competition is piling pressure on the 200-plus Chinese EV makers this year, with some leading players spearheading price cuts to lure customers.

    例句讲解：spearhead 表示“带头、领导”，通常用于比喻某人或某事在某一领域或活动中处于领先或主导地位。在这个例句中，spearhead 指的是一些领先的中国电动汽车制造商，它们率先降价以吸引消费者，从而在竞争中占据优势。

词组：

  • by up to - 最多可达，至多。

    原文例句：Tesla has cut the prices of its Shanghai-made vehicles by up to 6 per cent as it works to maintain its leading position in the premium segment of the world’s largest electric vehicle (EV) market.

    例句讲解：by up to 表示“最多可达”，通常用于表示某一数量或范围的最高限度。在这个例句中，by up to 6 per cent 表示特斯拉将其在上海制造的汽车的价格最高下调了 6%。

  • on par with - 与……相当，与……齐平。

    原文例句：The growth was nearly unchanged from the 37 per cent sales rise recorded in 2022 when it delivered about 440,000 vehicles.

    例句讲解：on par with 表示“与……相当，与……齐平”，通常用于比较两个或多个对象或事物之间的相似度或一致性。在这个例句中，on par with 表示 2023 年的销售增长与 2022 年的销售增长几乎持平。

句子：

  • Tesla has cut the prices of its Shanghai-made vehicles by up to 6 per cent as it works to maintain its leading position in the premium segment of the world’s largest electric vehicle (EV) market. - 特斯拉下调了其在上海制造的汽车的价格，最高降幅达 6%，旨在维持其在中国高级电动汽车 (EV) 市场上的领先地位。

    句子分析：本句为复句，主句是 Tesla has cut the prices，其语序为主语 + 谓语 + 宾语 + 状语。cut 是动词，表示“切割、削减”。prices 是宾语，意为“价格”。Shanghai-made vehicles 是由定冠词 the 和过去分词 Shanghai-made 修饰的复合宾语，意为“上海制造的汽车”。 状语 by up to 6 per cent 表示降价幅度最高可达 6%。从句 as it works to maintain its leading position in the premium segment of the world’s largest electric vehicle (EV) market 为定语从句，修饰先行词 Tesla，解释特斯拉降价的原因是维持其在全球最大的电动汽车市场的高级细分市场的领先地位。

语法：

  • 形容词比较级 - 表示两个或多个事物或人之间的比较。

    原文例句：Tesla also lowered the price of the dual-motor version of the Model 3 by 3.9 per cent to 285,900 yuan and offered a 2.1 per cent discount on the dual-motor Model Y, which now sells for 299,900 yuan.

    语法讲解：形容词比较级是形容词的一种形式，用于比较两个或多个事物或人之间的差异。比较级通常通过在形容词词尾加 -er 或 more 来形成。在这个例句中，lower 表示“更低”，是形容词 low 的比较级。cheaper 表示“更便宜”，是形容词 cheap 的比较级。

  • 过去时态 - 表示过去发生的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Tesla China cut prices on its Chinese-made models six times since January 2020.

    语法讲解：过去时态是动词的一种时态，用于表示过去发生的动作或状态。过去时态的形成一般是：has/have/had + 过去分词。在这个例句中，cut 是动词，过去分词是 cut。这句话的意思是：自 2020 年 1 月以来，特斯拉中国公司六次下调其中国制造车型的价格。

  • Carmaker cut prices by up to 6 per cent after reporting 15.7 per cent month-on-month sales growth to 75,805 units in mainland China in December
  • ‘Chinese home-grown rivals have launched a raft of new intelligent electric cars to mount a challenge to the US EV builder,’ analyst says

Tesla has cut the prices of its Shanghai-made vehicles by up to 6 per cent as it works to maintain its leading position in the premium segment of the world’s largest electric vehicle (EV) market.

The Texas-based company announced on Friday that the price of the entry-level edition of its Model 3 will be reduced from 261,400 yuan (US$36,814) to 245,900 yuan, while the starting price of the Model Y is now 258,900 yuan, down from 266,400 yuan.

The price cuts come after Tesla reported 15.7 per cent month-on-month sales growth to 75,805 units in mainland China in December, according to data released by the China Passenger Car Association.

“Tesla apparently hopes to maintain its market share in the highly competitive market,” said Phate Zhang, founder of Shanghai-based EV data provider CnEVPost. “Chinese home-grown rivals have launched a raft of new intelligent electric cars to mount a challenge to the US EV builder.”

Tesla also lowered the price of the dual-motor version of the Model 3 by 3.9 per cent to 285,900 yuan and offered a 2.1 per cent discount on the dual-motor Model Y, which now sells for 299,900 yuan.

The front-runner in China’s premium electric vehicle (EV) segment delivered 603,664 EVs made in its Shanghai Gigafactory to buyers in China last year, up 37.3 per cent from 2022. The growth was nearly unchanged from the 37 per cent sales rise recorded in 2022 when it delivered about 440,000 vehicles.

The company’s domestic rivals are not exactly nipping at its heels. Its closest competitor in the premium segment, Li Auto, delivered about 376,000 cars in 2023.

Tesla adjusts the prices of its locally built vehicles regularly based on production costs, Grace Tao, Tesla’s head of communications and government affairs in China, said on the microblogging site Weibo last January. Since January 2020, Tesla China cut prices on its Chinese-made models six times. This is the first reduction since August 2023; Tesla slightly raised prices between October and November when growth of deliveries in China slowed.

The Gigafactory, Tesla’s largest production hub worldwide, has an annual capacity of about 1 million units.

Aside from deliveries to mainland customers, the Shanghai factory also shipped 344,078 vehicles to markets like Japan and Germany in 2023, up 26.9 per cent year on year, according to data compiled by the CnEVPost.

Chinese EV maker shows off flying car but admits urban use is far off

Sales of electric cars in China jumped 37 per cent last year, with deliveries of pure EVs and plug-in hybrids hitting 8.9 million units. At present, mainland China accounts for about 60 per cent of global EV sales.

But sales growth of battery-powered vehicles in mainland China is expected to slow to 20 per cent year on year in 2024, according to a Fitch Ratings’ report in November.

Intensifying competition is piling pressure on the 200-plus Chinese EV makers this year, with some leading players spearheading price cuts to lure customers.

VW and GM lose ground to Chinese EV makers as petrol-heavy line-ups lose favour

A new round of price cuts is in effect, with BYD, the world’s largest EV maker, and Xpeng offering discounts to bolster sales.

Early last month, BYD cut the price of its Han luxury car by as much as 20,000 yuan to meet its annual sales target. Xpeng followed by cutting the price of its bestselling G6 SUV by 10,000 yuan, or about 5 per cent.

item.title: US$3 billion top Asia fund bets on Tencent again despite China gaming rules, favours Samsung over TSMC in chip market
item.description:
English Summary：

  • Federated Hermes Asia Ex-Japan Equity Fund's manager, Jonathan Pines, is bullish on the Chinese market despite government restrictions on online gaming.
  • The fund recently bought Tencent shares due to their attractive valuation despite the regulatory headwinds.
  • Tencent's shares are trading at less than 16 times forward earnings, making them attractive compared to their 10-year average.
  • Pines believes the risks of investing in China are worth taking due to the ultra-cheap valuations.
  • The fund also prefers Samsung Electronics over TSMC in the semiconductor space due to its better earnings prospects.

中文总结：

  • Federated Hermes Asia Ex-Japan Equity Fund的经理乔纳森·派恩斯对中国市场持乐观态度，尽管政府对在线游戏进行了限制。
  • 由于估值具有吸引力，该基金最近买入了腾讯股票，尽管面临监管方面的阻力。
  • 腾讯的股票交易价格低于16倍的远期收益，使其相比于10年平均水平具有吸引力。
  • 派恩斯认为，由于估值极低，投资中国的风险值得承担。
  • 由于收益前景更好，该基金在半导体领域也更青睐三星电子，而不是台积电。

单词：

  • outperform (v.) - /ˌaʊtˈpɜːrfɔːrm/ 表现优于，胜过。

    原文例句：Federated Hermes Asia Ex-Japan Equity Fund, which beat 83 per cent of its peers for the past three years, made the purchase in the new year.

    例句讲解：这个词是由out（超越，胜过）和perform（执行，完成）构成的，表示“表现优于，胜过”。在这个例句中，它表示Federated Hermes Asia Ex-Japan Equity Fund在过去三年中表现优于83%的同类基金。

  • valuation (n.) - /væljuˈeɪʃən/ 估值，价值。

    原文例句：Tencent yielded its position as Asia’s second-most valuable company after China’s new rules on online gaming erased US$53 billion off its market value in 2023.

    例句讲解：这个词是由value（价值，价值观）和-ation（形成名词的后缀）构成的，表示“估值，价值”。在这个例句中，它表示腾讯在亚洲第二大最有价值公司的排名，由于中国新的在线游戏规则而在2023年损失530亿美元市值后被撼动。

词组：

  • be worth taking - 值得冒险。

    原文例句：“We think the risks of investing in China are worth taking because the stocks are so cheap,” he said.

    例句讲解：这是一个习语，表示“值得冒险”。在这个例句中，它表示派恩斯认为，由于股票非常便宜，投资中国的风险值得承担。

句子：

  • China to curb excess spending on video games in blow for world’s biggest market. - 中国将遏制过度花费在视频游戏中，这对全球最大的市场来说是个打击。

    句子分析：这是一个动名词结构作主语的句子，主语是China to curb excess spending on video games in blow for world’s biggest market，谓语是will curb。这个句子表示中国将减少对视频游戏的过度支出，这对全球最大的市场来说是个打击。

语法：

  • 强调句型 - 用于强调句子的某个部分。

    原文例句：TSMC is due for a cyclical downturn, and its shares trade at nearly five times book value.

    语法讲解：这是一个强调句型，强调了TSMC即将面临周期性衰退的事实。它的结构是：It is/was + 被强调部分 + that/who + 其他。在这个例句中，被强调的部分是TSMC is due for a cyclical downturn，其他部分是and its shares trade at nearly five times book value。这个句子的意思是说，TSMC即将面临周期性衰退，而且其股票的交易价格接近账面价值的五倍。

  • 虚拟语气 - 用于表达假设、愿望或可能性。

    原文例句：“We think the risks of investing in China are worth taking because the stocks are so cheap,” he said.

    语法讲解：这是一个虚拟语气句子，表达了派恩斯对投资中国的看法。它的结构是：think/believe/say/hope + would/could/might/should + 其他。在这个例句中，think是情态动词，would是虚拟语气助动词，其他部分是the risks of investing in China are worth taking。这个句子的意思是说，派恩斯认为投资中国的风险是值得承担的，因为股票非常便宜。

  • Investment reflects fund’s optimism over beaten-down market, where valuations are ‘absolutely incredible’, says fund manager
  • Federated Hermes Asia Ex-Japan Equity Fund also prefers Samsung Electronics over TSMC in the semiconductor market

A fund that outperformed most of its peers has added Tencent Holdings back to its portfolio recently, betting on the gaming company’s attractive valuation despite further industry curbs by the Chinese government.

Federated Hermes Asia Ex-Japan Equity Fund, which beat 83 per cent of its peers for the past three years, made the purchase in the new year, even after China released a draft rule on gaming restrictions in December. The investment reflects the fund’s optimism over the nation’s beaten-down market, where valuations are “absolutely incredible”, said Jonathan Pines, who manages the US$3.1 billion fund.

“We are buying it now because of its very cheap value,” he said in an interview Wednesday, referring to Tencent’s shares. Pines’ fund sold most of its shares in Tencent as well as in Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) about a year ago.

Tencent yielded its position as Asia’s second-most valuable company after China’s new rules on online gaming erased US$53 billion off its market value in 2023, capping a third year of losses. The shares trade at less than 16 times forward earnings, or about half the 10-year average, making them attractive, Pines said.

ByteDance confirms talks with Tencent, other buyers for video game operations

While China currently is not the preferred investment destination for many, a combination of ultra-cheap valuations and low allocations outweighs the risks of investing in the nation’s stocks, according to Pines.

“We think the risks of investing in China are worth taking because the stocks are so cheap,” he said.

The fund, which is also overweight on South Korea, prefers Samsung Electronics to TSMC in the Asia semiconductor space.

China to curb excess spending on video games in blow for world’s biggest market

TSMC is due for a cyclical downturn, and its shares trade at nearly five times book value, while Samsung’s earnings are poised to recover, Pines said, adding that the Korean company’s position in the memory chip sector makes it a better place to be for now.

While Korea’s largest company this week reported a steeper-than-expected 35 per cent drop in operating income, reflecting weak demand for consumer electronics globally, Pines said the results would not prevent him from being positive on its earnings trajectory. “Things are going to improve from here,” he said.

item.title: Google slashes over 1,000 jobs to focus on AI amid competition with Microsoft, OpenAI
item.description:
English Summary:

  • Due to rising costs and intensifying rivalry in the AI field, Google announced layoffs affecting its digital assistant, hardware, and engineering divisions.
  • The streamlining strategy is intended to prioritize crucial projects and resource distribution.
  • Vice presidents, directors, and general staff have all been let go, impacting over 1,000 employees in total.
  • Employees expressed uncertainty and dissatisfaction, with some citing a focus on cost-cutting over staff well-being.
  • Google has previously undertaken smaller-scale layoffs in 2023 and experienced a larger wave of job cuts in January 2023.
  • Despite the layoffs, Google assured that affected employees will have opportunities to apply for other positions within the company.

中文总结：

  • 因成本上升和人工智能领域竞争加剧，谷歌宣布裁员，涉及数字助理、硬件和工程部门。
  • 精简策略旨在优先考虑关键项目和资源分配。
  • 此次裁员影响了副总裁、董事和普通员工，总计超过1000人。
  • 员工对公司做法表示不确定和不满，有人认为公司过于注重成本削减，而忽略了员工福祉。
  • 谷歌在2023年曾进行过小规模裁员，并在2023年1月经历了更大规模的裁员。
  • 尽管裁员，谷歌保证受影响员工将有机会申请公司内的其他职位。

单词：

  • priority (n.) - /praɪˈɔːrəti/ 优先权，优先事项。

    原文例句：The central engineering organisation was also hit by cuts, the company said.

    例句讲解：这个单词来自法语词根priorité，意思是“优先权，优先事项”。在这个例句中，它指的是谷歌的核心工程部门也受到了裁员的影响。

  • scrutinize (v.) - /ˈskrutinʌɪz/ 仔细检查，仔细审视。

    原文例句：Google executives pledged to scrutinise their operations to identify places where they can make cuts, and free up resources to invest in their biggest priorities.

    例句讲解：这个单词来自拉丁语词根scruta，意思是“搜索，调查”。在这个例句中，它指的是谷歌的管理层承诺仔细检查他们的运营情况，以找出可以削减成本的地方，并腾出资源投资于他们的最大优先事项。

  • elimination (n.) - /ɪˌlɪmɪˈneɪʃən/ 消除，淘汰。

    原文例句：“Some teams are continuing to make these kinds of organisational changes, which include some role eliminations globally.”

    例句讲解：这个单词来自拉丁语词根eliminare，意思是“消除，淘汰”。在这个例句中，它指的是一些团队继续进行这些类型的组织变革，其中包括在全球范围内淘汰一些职位。

词组：

  • be let go - 被解雇。

    原文例句：Disclosures filed by Google with the state of California show that 630 workers in the state have been let go this week, including four vice-presidents and 25 directors.

    例句讲解：这个词组由be（是，被）和let go（释放，放开）组成，意思是“被解雇”。在这个例句中，它指的是谷歌向加州提交的披露文件显示，本周该州有630名员工被解雇，其中包括四名副总裁和25名董事。

  • get a full picture of - 了解全貌，获得完整的信息。

    原文例句：Workers said it was difficult to get a full picture of how many jobs were affected.

    例句讲解：这个词组由get（得到，获得）和a full picture of（一幅完整的图画）组成，意思是“了解全貌，获得完整的信息”。在这个例句中，它指的是员工表示很难了解有多少个工作岗位受到影响。

  • fear of professional repercussions - 对职业后果的恐惧。

    原文例句：The worker said it has killed morale at the company and is not conducive to creating trust.

    例句讲解：这个词组由fear（恐惧）of（对）professional（专业的）repercussions（后果）组成，意思是“对职业后果的恐惧”。在这个例句中，它指的是这名员工表示，这件事已经让公司的士气跌到了谷底，而且也不利于建立信任。

句子：

  • The central engineering organisation was also hit by cuts, the company said. - 该公司表示，核心工程部门也受到了裁员的影响。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是The company said，其中主语是The company，谓语是said，宾语是central engineering organisation was also hit by cuts。central engineering organisation是中心工程部门，cuts是削减，hit by cuts是受到了削减，意思是中心工程部门也受到了裁员的影响。这是一个被动语态的句子，表示中心工程部门是被裁员的。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Google executives pledged to scrutinise their operations to identify places where they can make cuts, and free up resources to invest in their biggest priorities.

    语法讲解：现在完成时是一种时态，结构是：have/has + been + 现在分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，它表示谷歌的管理层承诺仔细检查他们的运营情况，以找出可以削减成本的地方，并腾出资源投资于他们的最大优先事项。这是一个现在完成时的句子，表示这个动作是从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作的持续性和未完成性。

  • 虚拟语气 - 表示假设、愿望或不现实的情况。

    原文例句：“Some teams are continuing to make these kinds of organisational changes, which include some role eliminations globally.”

    语法讲解：虚拟语气是一种语态，用于表示假设、愿望或不现实的情况。虚拟语气有两种形式：陈述语气和命令语气。陈述语气用在从句中，以was、were、had等形式出现。命令语气用在祈使句中，以let、may等形式出现。在这个例句中，它使用的是陈述语气的虚拟语气，表示一些团队继续进行这些类型的组织变革，其中包括在全球范围内淘汰一些职位。这是一个虚拟语气的句子，表示这个情况是不现实的或假设的。

  • The affected employees include those working on the voice-based Google Assistant and the augmented reality hardware team
  • The cuts struck both rank-and-file employees and executives, including four vice-presidents and 25 directors

Alphabet’s Google is laying off hundreds of people working on its digital assistant, hardware and engineering teams as part of a continued effort to lower costs and focus on artificial intelligence (AI).

The affected employees included those working on the voice-based Google Assistant and the augmented reality hardware team. The central engineering organisation was also hit by cuts, the company said.

The reductions come as Google’s core internet search business feels the heat from the AI offerings of rivals Microsoft and ChatGPT-creator OpenAI. On calls with investors in recent months, Google executives pledged to scrutinise their operations to identify places where they can make cuts, and free up resources to invest in their biggest priorities.

“Throughout the second half of 2023, a number of our teams made changes to become more efficient and work better, and to align their resources to their biggest product priorities,” a spokesperson for the Mountain View, California-based company said in a statement. “Some teams are continuing to make these kinds of organisational changes, which include some role eliminations globally.”

Alphabet shares were little changed on Thursday, closing at US$142.08 in New York.

The cuts struck both rank-and-file employees and executives. Disclosures filed by Google with the state of California show that 630 workers in the state have been let go this week, including four vice-presidents and 25 directors. Employees at those levels often earn millions of dollars per year in compensation, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

The Alphabet Workers Union, which represents some Google employees, said more than 1,000 workers have been let go so far in total.

The co-founders of Fitbit, James Park and Eric Friedman, are also leaving Google as part of the reorganisation, a company spokesperson confirmed. Google acquired the smartwatch company in 2019 for US$2.1 billion.

Workers at the search giant have been on edge since January of last year, when Alphabet said it would cut about 12,000 jobs, more than 6 per cent of its global workforce. That sent shock waves through Silicon Valley.

The company continued to make smaller trims over the course of 2023, including lay-offs within teams focused on recruiting, news products and the Waze mapping app.

While the large round of cuts in January 2023 was telegraphed by Alphabet chief executive officer Sundar Pichai, this year’s reductions have been communicated by lower-level leaders, such as vice-presidents and human resources, according to a current employee and a former worker.

Googlers and recently laid-off employees shared information with each other about the cuts in Discord chats, hallway conversations and other social networks, two current employees told Bloomberg. A document noting which roles got cut, as well as resources for laid-off coworkers, circulated among workers on Wednesday and Thursday, one worker said.

Staffers thought the company leadership would have learned from the outcry that large-scale job losses provoked last year, a current employee said, noting that Google is focused almost exclusively on cost-cutting now. The employee said everyone is talking about having a Plan B.

Microsoft’s AI bets lift cloud business, as Google Cloud disappoints

Workers said it was difficult to get a full picture of how many jobs were affected. Google – which had about 182,000 employees as of September 30, according to regulatory filings – said more cuts could be expected throughout January as decisions are made at the department level.

The company employed 190,700 workers before the lay-offs last year, in addition to tens of thousands of contractors around the world.

One of the Google employees who lost his job this week said the first sign of trouble came when he tried to check his work email, only to find he had been logged off. He found a message delivering the news that he had lost his job in his personal email.

Over the past year, there have been several rounds of micro-lay-offs, the worker said, speaking on condition of anonymity for fear of professional repercussions. He said it has killed morale at the company and is not conducive to creating trust.

Some Googlers have come to view January as a new grim annual tradition of mass lay-offs.

While Google executives have framed the cuts as a way to refocus resources on the company’s biggest priorities, the worker who was just fired said that he and a number of his teammates who were let go were working on AI.

Amazon.com also laid off hundreds of staff in its Prime Video and studios business this week, raising questions about whether another major round of job cuts was under way in Silicon Valley.

Semafor first reported the lay-offs to the Google Assistant team, while 9to5Google first reported the reorganisation for hardware. Affected staff have begun receiving the news and will have the opportunity to apply for open positions elsewhere within Google, the company said.

item.title: US bitcoin ETF trades soar to US$4.6 billion on first day after landmark SEC approval
item.description:
English summary：

  • Eleven new bitcoin spot ETFs launched in the US, sparking fierce competition for market share and boosting the price of bitcoin to its highest level since December 2021.
  • The ETFs, known as spot bitcoin ETFs, represent a milestone for the cryptocurrency industry and will test acceptance of digital assets as investments.
  • Grayscale, BlackRock, and Fidelity saw substantial trading volumes after the ETFs began trading, and several firms cut their fees to attract investors.
  • The SEC gave the green light for the ETFs despite lingering concerns about investor protection, stating that the approval does not endorse bitcoin.
  • Fees for the new bitcoin ETFs range from 0.2% to 1.5%, with some waiving fees initially to attract investors.
  • The launch of the ETFs has raised cautious optimism for the future of crypto ETFs, including spot ether products.

Chinese summary：

  • 11只比特币现货ETF在美国上市，包括来自贝莱德集团、灰度投资和富达投资的ETF，引发了激烈的市场份额竞争，并将比特币价格推高至自2021年12月以来的最高水平。
  • 这些ETF被称作现货比特币ETF，代表了加密货币行业的一个里程碑，将检验数字资产作为投资品的认可程度。
  • 在ETF开始交易后，灰度投资、贝莱德集团和富达投资的交易量大幅增加，多家公司下调费用以吸引投资者。
  • 尽管仍存在对投资者保护的担忧，但美国证券交易委员会(SEC)批准了这些ETF，并表示批准并不意味着认可比特币。
  • 新比特币ETF的费用范围为0.2%至1.5%，部分公司最初免收费用以吸引投资者。
  • ETF的推出为加密货币ETF的未来发展带来了谨慎乐观的态度，包括现货以太币产品。

Words：

  • scheme (n.) - /skiːm/ 计划，方案，策略。

    原文例句：Such schemes are also present in electrical grids and other complex systems.

    例句讲解：这个单词是由scheme（计划，方案）演变而来的，含义类似于plan（计划，方案）或strategy（策略），具体语境中是指电网和其他复杂系统中的计划或策略。

Phrases：

  • mark a watershed moment - 标志一个分水岭时刻。

    原文例句：The products mark a watershed moment for the cryptocurrency industry that will test whether digital assets – still viewed by many professionals as risky – can gain broader acceptance as an investment.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由mark（标记，标志），watershed（分水岭，转折点）和moment（时刻）组成的，表示“标志一个分水岭时刻”。在这个例句中，它表示这些产品标志着加密货币行业的一个分水岭时刻，将检验数字资产作为投资品是否能获得更广泛的认可。

Sentences：

  • Grayscale, BlackRock and Fidelity dominated trading volumes, the LSEG data showed. - 交易所集团数据显示，灰度投资、贝莱德和富达在交易量上占据主导地位。

    句子分析：这是一个简单的句子，主语是Grayscale, BlackRock and Fidelity，谓语是dominated，宾语是trading volumes。the LSEG data showed是一个过去分词短语作状语，表示交易所集团数据显示。这个句子的意思是说，交易所集团数据显示，灰度投资、贝莱德和富达在交易量上占据主导地位。

Grammar：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：The Berkshire Hathaway CEO said in his annual letter to shareholders that he has avoided investing in cryptocurrencies.

    语法讲解：这种时态是现在时和过去时的结合，表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。结构是：have/has + been + 现在分词。have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。在这个例句中，it表示伯克希尔·哈撒韦公司的首席执行官在他的致股东的年度信函中表示，他一直避免投资加密货币。

  • Eleven spot bitcoin ETFs – including those from BlackRock, Grayscale and Fidelity – began trading in the US on Thursday
  • The ETF launches lifted the price of bitcoin up to its highest level since December 2021

US-listed bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) saw US$4.6 billion worth of shares trade hands as of Thursday afternoon, according to LSEG data, as investors jumped into the landmark products approved by the US securities regulator on Wednesday.

The products mark a watershed moment for the cryptocurrency industry that will test whether digital assets – still viewed by many professionals as risky – can gain broader acceptance as an investment.

Eleven spot bitcoin ETFs – including BlackRock’s iShares Bitcoin Trust, Grayscale Bitcoin Trust and ARK 21Shares Bitcoin ETF, among others – began trading Thursday morning, kicking off a fierce competition for market share.

Grayscale, BlackRock and Fidelity dominated trading volumes, the LSEG data showed.

“Trading volumes have been relatively strong for new ETF products,” said Todd Rosenbluth, strategist at VettaFi. “But this is a longer race than just a single day’s trading.

The green light from the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) for the products finally came late on Wednesday, following a decade-long tussle with the crypto industry.

Some executives called out bitcoin as a high-risk investment, and Vanguard – the largest provider of mutual funds – said it had no plans to make the new batch of spot bitcoin ETFs available on its platform to its brokerage clients.

The SEC had earlier rejected all spot bitcoin ETFs on investor protection concerns. SEC chairman Gary Gensler said in a statement on Wednesday that the approvals were not an endorsement of bitcoin, calling it a “speculative, volatile asset”.

The ETF launches lifted the price of bitcoin up to its highest level since December 2021. It was last up 0.77 per cent at US$46,303, while the price of ether, the second-largest cryptocurrency, was up 2.79 per cent at US$2597.95.

RACE FOR MARKET SHARE

The regulatory nod sparked intense competition for market share among the issuers, some of whom slashed the fees for their products well below the US ETF industry’s standard even before Thursday’s launch.

Fees on the new bitcoin ETFs range from 0.2 per cent to 1.5 per cent, with many firms also offering to waive fees entirely for a certain period or for a certain dollar volume of assets. After its ETF started trading, Valkyrie cut its fees a second time to 0.25 per cent and waived them for the first three months.

Grayscale was approved to convert its existing bitcoin trust into an ETF on Thursday, overnight creating the world’s largest bitcoin ETF with more than US$28 billion in assets under management.

Estimates for how much spot bitcoin ETFs could reel in vary widely. Analysts at Bernstein estimated that flows will build up gradually to cross US$10 billion in 2024, while Standard Chartered analysts this week said the ETFs could draw US$50 billion to US$100 billion this year alone. Other analysts have said inflows could be US$55 billion over five years.

As the ETFs began trading on Thursday, market participants were closely watching bid-ask spreads: the difference between the price for a trader to buy into an ETF and the price it can be sold. ETFs with narrower spreads are typically viewed as more desirable.

Trading volume, internal plumbing and the number of participants involved “are critically important to driving the spreads to a good spot”, said Jason Stoneberg, director of product strategy at Invesco, whose ETF with Galaxy Digital debuted on Thursday.

Some analysts cautioned that the euphoria around the approval might be premature. The broader investment community still views cryptocurrencies as risky, with scandals such as the implosion of crypto exchange FTX in 2022 adding to investors’ wariness.

A Vanguard spokeswoman said the firm had no plans to launch its own crypto investment products, and that its focus remains on core asset classes such as stocks, bonds and cash, which it views “as the blocks of a well-balanced, long-term investment portfolio”.

Speaking at a webinar on Thursday, Sharmin Mossavar-Rahmani, head of the Investment Strategy Group and chief investment officer of wealth management at Goldman Sachs, said cryptocurrencies had no place in an investment portfolio.

“When you think about it, where is there any value to something like bitcoin?” she said. “We don’t think it is an asset class to invest in.”

CRYPTO STOCKS GAIN

Still, some expect the products to pave the way for even more innovative crypto ETFs, including spot ether products.

Grayscale CEO Michael Sonnenshein said in an interview Thursday that the firm plans to file for a covered call ETF in an effort to allow investors to generate income from options on its spot bitcoin product.

Cryptocurrency-related stocks initially climbed higher on Thursday, but ended the day lower, with bitcoin miners Riot Platforms and Marathon Digital dropping 15.8 per cent and 12.6 per cent respectively.

Bitcoin investor Microstrategy fell 5.2 per cent and crypto exchange Coinbase 6.7 per cent. The ProShares Bitcoin Strategy ETF, which tracks bitcoin futures, gained 0.44 per cent.

Also on Thursday, Circle Internet Financial, the company behind stablecoin USDC, said it had confidentially filed for a US initial public offering. Circle controls the issuance and governance of USDC, a cryptocurrency pegged to the US dollar.

item.title: European Union not in ‘Champions League’ of economic security, ASML rep says
item.description:
English Summary：

In the wake of Chinese pressure, ASML's top lobbyist in the EU, Wouter Baljon, criticizes the European Union's handling of economic security. He believes that the EU should aim to be in the "Champions League" of economic security, but its performance is currently at the "Europa League" level, lagging behind countries like the United States, China, Japan, South Korea, and Taiwan. He is concerned about the EU's overreliance on export controls as an instrument for addressing concerns about China's industrial progress and the risk this poses to European competitiveness.
  • Abstract: EU criticized for its economic security approach and its overreliance on export controls in managing relations with China.
  • Theme: A critical assessment of the EU's economic security policies by a leading Dutch technology company.
  • Viewpoint: ASML's viewpoint is that the EU needs to step up its economic security game and avoid overly restrictive measures that harm European competitiveness.
  • Main Information: ASML's criticism of the EU's economic security approach; concerns about the impact of export controls on the European tech industry; the need for a more balanced and comprehensive strategy.

中文总结：

因中国施压，ASML欧盟首席说客沃特·巴尔扬批评欧盟处理经济安全的方式。他认为，欧盟应争取进入经济安全的“冠军联赛”，但目前仅达到“欧罗巴联赛”水准，落后于美国、中国、日本、韩国和台湾等国家。他担忧欧盟过度依赖出口管制，以此作为应对中国工业进步担忧的手段，并认为这将危及欧洲竞争力。
  • 摘要：欧盟因处理经济安全和管理对华关系时过度依赖出口管制而受到批评。
  • 主题：荷兰领先科技公司对欧盟经济安全政策的严厉评估。
  • 观点：ASML认为欧盟需要提升经济安全水平，避免损害欧洲竞争力的过度限制性措施。
  • 主要信息：ASML对欧盟经济安全政策的批评；对出口管制影响欧洲科技产业的担忧；欧盟有必要采取更均衡、全面的策略。

单词：

  • Geopolitical - (adj.) 地缘政治的，地缘战略的

    原文例句：Its executives should have a good idea of who’s who in the pantheon of geopolitical arm-twisting, having been caught in the cross hairs of a fierce US-China tech war.

    例句讲解：Geopolitical一词由geo-（地球）和political（政治）组成，表示与地理和政治相关的事物。在这个例句中，它被用来描述美国和中国之间的激烈技术战争的背景，其中ASML公司因其在全球芯片制造业中的重要地位而受到影响。

  • litigation (n.) - /ˌlɪtɪˈgeɪʃən/ 诉讼，法律诉讼。

    原文例句：The Russian businessman has been locked in a legal tussle with the sanctioned lender since litigation began in early 2019.

    例句讲解：litigation由litigate（诉讼）和-ion（事物，过程）组成，表示法律诉讼或争端。在这个例句中，它指的是俄罗斯商人自2019年初开始与受制裁的贷款人之间的法律纠纷。

词组：

  • cross hairs - 十字准线，瞄准线。

    原文例句：Its executives should have a good idea of who’s who in the pantheon of geopolitical arm-twisting, having been caught in the cross hairs of a fierce US-China tech war.

    例句讲解：cross hairs是一个军事术语，指的是瞄准镜或枪支上用来瞄准目标的十字准线。在这个例句中，它比喻ASML公司因其在全球芯片制造业中的重要地位而受到美国和中国两国的高度关注，就像被十字准线瞄准一样。

  • economic security - 经济安全

    原文例句：The European Union is not in the “Champions League of economic security”, and even “struggles to perform at Europa League level”.That was the withering assessment of a senior representative of ASML, Europe’s most valuable technology company, who used a football analogy to attack Brussels’ efforts to de-risk its relations with China.

    例句讲解：economic security是一个经济学术语，指的是一个国家或地区能够保障其经济利益和持续发展不受外部因素干扰和破坏的能力。在这个例句中，它指的是欧盟在经济安全领域的表现被认为不如美国、中国、日本等国家，甚至连韩国和台湾也无法相比。

句子：

  • The American policy was “all about curtailing the ability of China to make industrial progress”, Baljon said, adding that the EU was living in “la-la land” if it thought otherwise. - 巴尔扬说，美国的政策“完全是为了限制中国取得工业进步”，他补充说，如果欧盟认为不是这样，那它就生活在“梦幻世界”里。

    句子分析：这是一个长句，主句是American policy was 是什么，其中主语是American policy，谓语是was，宾语是all about curtailing the ability of China to make industrial progress。添加的部分是Baljon说和如果欧盟认为不是这样，那它就生活在“梦幻世界”里。这两个部分都是句子的一部分，其中Baljon说是一个独立分句，起着强调的作用；而如果欧盟认为不是这样，那它就生活在“梦幻世界”里是一个条件状语从句，对主句起着限制和说明的作用。这个句子的意思是说，巴尔扬说，美国的政策“完全是为了限制中国取得工业进步”，他补充说，如果欧盟认为不是这样，那它就生活在“梦幻世界”里。

语法：

  • should have - 助动词，表示应该，应当。

    原文例句：Its executives should have a good idea of who’s who in the pantheon of geopolitical arm-twisting, having been caught in the cross hairs of a fierce US-China tech war.

    语法讲解：should have是一个助动词，用来表示应该，应当，或义务。它通常与have一起使用，构成should have + 宾语结构。在这个例句中，should have表示ASML的高管们应该对地缘政治领域的谁是谁有很好的了解。

  • being caught in the cross hairs - 陷入十字准线，处于不利境地。

    原文例句：Its executives should have a good idea of who’s who in the pantheon of geopolitical arm-twisting, having been caught in the cross hairs of a fierce US-China tech war.

    语法讲解：being caught in the cross hairs是一个介词短语，意为陷入十字准线，处于不利境地。它通常用作比喻，表示陷入激烈的竞争或冲突中。在这个例句中，it表示ASML公司。这个介词短语是对ASML公司在中美科技战中所处困境的形象描述。

  • Dutch semiconductor equipment giant among several business groups on continent critical of Brussels’ efforts to de-risk its relations with Beijing
  • American policy “all about curtailing the ability of China to make industrial progress”, ASML’s top EU lobbyist adds

The European Union is not in the “Champions League of economic security”, and even “struggles to perform at Europa League level”.

That was the withering assessment of a senior representative of ASML, Europe’s most valuable technology company, who used a football analogy to attack Brussels’ efforts to de-risk its relations with China.

“If you think about the Champions League of economic security and geoeconomic statecraft, we have to think of the United States, we have to think of China, and we also have to think of Japan,” said Wouter Baljon, the Dutch company’s top EU lobbyist, referring to Europe’s premier football tournament.

“If you think of the Europa League, or tier two, we look at countries particularly in our industry, like [South] Korea, like Taiwan, and at best Europe, the EU as a collective.

“The EU clearly … aspires to be in the Champions League, but for high technology, they struggled to perform at Europa League-level,” said Baljon at an event in Brussels on Wednesday, referring to the continent’s inferior competition.

ASML, valued at US$285 billion, is the world leader in the chipmaking equipment essential for manufacturing advanced semiconductors and considered the crown jewel in Europe’s tech sector.

Its executives should have a good idea of who’s who in the pantheon of geopolitical arm-twisting, having been caught in the cross hairs of a fierce US-China tech war.

ASML has been forced to stop selling some advanced precision lithography machines to Chinese buyers at the behest of the Biden administration.

ASML blocked from shipping chip-making equipment to China ahead of deadline

The American policy was “all about curtailing the ability of China to make industrial progress”, Baljon said, adding that the EU was living in “la-la land” if it thought otherwise.

“We haven’t acknowledged that export controls have become an industrial policy instrument. We still live in this la-la land that it’s about dual-use goods, it’s military-civil fusion.”

Baljon delivered his comments in Brussels during an event hosted by the European Policy Centre on the EU’s capacity to act as an economic security power as it looks to reduce its dependencies on Beijing.

Earlier in the day, EU industry chief Thierry Breton described Europe as a “third bloc” in a multipolar world.

“We need to continue to promote Europe as a third bloc, a balancing force between the US and China,” the commissioner said at the event. “Of course, we will remain an open continent, but on our terms, more assertive than ever.”

However, ASML’s representative was less confident, saying the European Commission would struggle to define an economic security strategy without the buy-in of powerful member states, which have pushed back against the policy.

“A certain humbleness might certainly help the EU to act as a collective, particularly in high technology,” said Baljon. “We are not an incumbent unfortunately. As the EU 27, we are a challenger, and we need the instruments and the approaches to reflect this.”

“We might speak of the ‘geopolitical commission’, but at this point, I think it’s only as geopolitical as [the] Franco-German axis allows it to be, and you also don’t have the manpower to really be in this Champions League.”

China’s imports of Dutch chip-making equipment surged tenfold in November

The EU will present an “initiative” on screening outbound investments and a proposal on export controls for four crucial technologies, including microchips, on January 24. These form part of a package of tools aimed at de-risking its trading ties with China.

Baljon’s remarks were among a series of broadsides voiced at the event as businesses lined up to criticise the EU’s plans.

Malte Lohan, director general of Orgalim, a trade association representing Europe’s tech industries, said firms in his sector were facing “a tsunami of regulation”.

“You can’t just regulate your way to economic security from a few office blocks in Brussels,” Lohan said, adding he was “very nervous” about an “unprecedented shift to public intervention in our supply chains”.

EU firms are reluctant to speak up on China as Brussels tries to de-risk

“If you look at any one of the instruments in isolation, of course there’s always a very good reason for it … I think we need to accept that this is a completely new paradigm in terms of how supply chains are regulated through public-sector intervention.”

Luisa Santos, deputy director general at BusinessEurope, another lobby group, said the EU endangered its competitiveness by putting security concerns ahead of economic growth.

The war in Ukraine had “created a new consensus in the business community” on the security issues Europe faces, she said.

“But we should not overdo it also, because we have other problems that we need to deal with and we have not dealt with yet, including our competitiveness … what we have seen in these last years is that compared to other partners in terms of overall competitiveness … we [in Europe] are not in such good shape.”

item.title: CES 2024: China smartphone brand Realme unveils new handset on sidelines of trade show as its biggest rivals stay home
item.description:
English Summary：

Realme unveiled its new 12 Pro+ smartphone at a parallel event during CES 2024, targeting young users with better zoom capabilities in a budget device. The company emphasized its commitment to providing outstanding products for users at every price segment. Realme aims to double down on what it believes young users want most in a smartphone, which is better photos when zooming in.
  • Abstract: Realme launched the 12 Pro+ smartphone with improved zoom capabilities aimed at young users.
  • Theme: Realme's focus on providing outstanding products and targeting young users with its budget-friendly smartphone.
  • Viewpoint: The importance of understanding and catering to the needs of young users in the smartphone market.
  • Main information: Realme's launch of the 12 Pro+ smartphone and its strategy to target young users with budget-friendly devices.

中文总结：

Realme在CES 2024期间的平行活动中发布了新的12 Pro+智能手机，以更好的变焦功能为预算有限的年轻用户群体提供服务。该公司强调致力于为各个价位段的用户提供出色的产品。Realme旨在加倍努力提供他们认为年轻用户在智能手机上最想要的功能，即在变焦时获得更好的照片。
  • 摘要：Realme发布了具有改进变焦功能的12 Pro+智能手机，目标是年轻用户。
  • 主题：Realme专注于提供优秀的产品并以其经济实惠的智能手机定位年轻用户。
  • 观点：理解和满足智能手机市场中年轻用户需求的重要性。
  • 主要信息：Realme发布12 Pro+智能手机并制定策略以经济实惠的设备定位年轻用户。

单词：

  • handset (n.) - /ˈhændˌset/ 手持式电话，手机。

    原文例句：Realme unveiled the 12 Pro+ smartphone at an event parallel to the CES trade show.

    例句讲解：Handset是指手持式电话或手机，在这个例句中，它指的是Realme在CES贸易展期间的平行活动中发布的12 Pro+智能手机。

  • exhibitor (n.) - /ɪɡˈzɪbɪtər/ 参展商。

    原文例句：While not an official exhibitor at CES, Realme was one of only two major Chinese smartphone brands to show up in Las Vegas this week.

    例句讲解：Exhibitor是指参展商，在这个例句中，它指的是Realme虽然不是CES的官方参展商，但它是本周在拉斯维加斯出现的仅有的两大中国智能手机品牌之一。

词组：

  • parallel to - 与……平行，与……同时进行。

    原文例句：Realme unveiled the 12 Pro+ smartphone at an event parallel to the CES trade show.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由parallel（平行的）和to（向……）构成的，表示“与……平行，与……同时进行”。在这个例句中，它表示Realme在与CES贸易展平行的活动中发布了12 Pro+智能手机。

  • on the sidelines of - 在……期间，在……之际。

    原文例句：Chinese smartphone maker Realme held a parallel event in Las Vegas on the sidelines of the CES trade show to unveil its new handset.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由on（在……上）, the（定冠词）, sidelines（侧面，边缘）和of（属于，关于）构成的，表示“在……期间，在……之际”。在这个例句中，它表示中国智能手机制造商Realme在CES贸易展期间在拉斯维加斯举行了一场平行活动来发布其新手机。

句子：

  • Realme unveiled the 12 Pro+ smartphone at an event parallel to the CES trade show. - Realme在CES贸易展期间的平行活动中发布了12 Pro+智能手机。

    句子分析：这是一个主动语态的句子，主语是Realme，谓语是unveiled，宾语是the 12 Pro+ smartphone，介词短语at an event parallel to the CES trade show表示Realme在CES贸易展期间的平行活动中发布了这款手机。这个句子的意思是说，Realme在CES贸易展期间的平行活动中发布了12 Pro+智能手机。

  • The company is targeting young users with better zoom capabilities in a budget device. - 该公司以更好的变焦功能为预算有限的年轻用户群体提供服务。

    句子分析：这是一个主动语态的句子，主语是The company，谓语是is targeting，宾语是young users，介词短语with better zoom capabilities in a budget device表示该公司以更好的变焦功能为预算有限的年轻用户群体提供服务。这个句子的意思是说，该公司以更好的变焦功能为预算有限的年轻用户群体提供服务。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在或已经完成的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Realme has been selling in parts of Europe and Latin America, which it described as an important market for the company’s upcoming 12-series handsets.

    语法讲解：现在完成时是一种时态，结构是：have/has + been + 现在分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在或已经完成，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性或完成性。在这个例句中，它表示Realme一直在欧洲和拉丁美洲的部分地区销售，该公司将其描述为其即将推出的12系列手机的重要市场。这个句子的意思是说，Realme一直在欧洲和拉丁美洲的部分地区销售，该公司将其描述为其即将推出的12系列手机的重要市场。

  • The new 12 Pro+ handset to launch at the end of January provides a better zoom lens at a budget price, as Realme caters to young overseas users
  • Realme sister brand OnePlus was also in Las Vegas, while Xiaomi, Oppo and Vivo sat out the world’s largest consumer electronics show

Chinese smartphone maker Realme, owned by mainland consumer hardware giant BBK Electronics which also controls Oppo and Vivo, held a parallel event in Las Vegas on the sidelines of the CES trade show to unveil its new handset as part of a rebranding effort targeting young overseas users.

While not an official exhibitor at CES, Realme was one of only two major Chinese smartphone brands to show up in Las Vegas this week. On Wednesday, Realme introduced its 12-series smartphones at the same hotel where its sister brand, OnePlus, had a series of suites booked for its own presentations outside CES.

Realme said its latest 12 Pro+ handset has the largest sensor in any periscope lens on a smartphone sold globally, but pointed out that the company’s GT 5 Pro handset sold in China technically has a bigger lens.

“What sets us apart from other brands is that we are fully committed to the young generation,” Sam Cheung, senior marketing communications manager for Realme, said in his presentation during the firm’s hour-long event on the sidelines of CES 2024. “At Realme, we believe that every user at every price segment deserves an outstanding product.”

Realme, which did not reveal pricing for its latest handsets, said the chipset used in the 12 Pro+ will not be made public until closer to its formal launch. While the new device uses a mid-tier Qualcomm processor, Realme said it collaborated with the US chip design firm on a solution to improve image-processing speed.

The 11 Pro+ smartphone launched by Realme last year costs 2,799 yuan, or about US$400.

At its event, Realme said the firm’s slogan, “Dare to leap”, has been changed to “Make it real” as part of a rebranding effort.

The company said it was focused on a niche market segment, where it has found success overseas at a time when global smartphone sales are slumping and China’s post-pandemic economic recovery has sputtered.

Realme acknowledged challenges from the pandemic, component shortages and longer replacement cycles from consumers, but the firm also touted its sales numbers – more than 200 million handsets sold since its incubation at Oppo – as “giving us confidence that we’re on to something”.

China’s Realme surges past 200 million smartphone shipments

Moving forward, Realme aims to double down on what it believes young users want most in a smartphone. The answer it came up with is better photos when zooming in. So the firm has combined a half-inch sensor with a 3x optical zoom periscope lens and built that in its mid-tier line of smartphones.

It also collaborated with watch designer Ollivier Savéo, who previously worked at Rolex and Piaget, among others, on a design evocative of famed Swiss watches.

At a time of rising scrutiny of all things Chinese, Realme made its latest product announcement in a country leading the charge against tech from China and where the company does not even sell smartphones.

For all the other missing Chinese brands – and the smattering of journalists and influencers who showed up to cover the Realme event – it may as well have been part of the show. Vivo and Oppo, two of China’s biggest smartphone brands, were nowhere to be found in Las Vegas, even though Realme spun out of Oppo. OnePlus, the Oppo-owned brand, had suites booked for private showings, but also had no presence on the CES exhibition floor.

Tech giants Alibaba, ByteDance lead China’s return to CES

Neither Xiaomi nor US-blacklisted Huawei Technologies were at CES.

Realme said it did not exhibit at CES because the 12 Pro+ handset has not officially launched yet. It organised a pre-briefing in Las Vegas because many of its contacts across a variety of markets would be in town for the world’s largest consumer electronics show.

While the company set a goal last year of selling in more than 100 markets over the next five years, the United States is one market where it may not expand owing to the complexities of getting domestic network carrier support.

The bulk of US handset sales still happen through mobile network operators, forcing smartphone brands to strike deals to find success. OnePlus has struggled with this situation, despite the glowing reviews received by many of its devices from US tech media.

Realme said it was still trying to cooperate with a US carrier to get into the market, where 87 per cent of teenagers own an iPhone, according to a survey by investment bank Piper Sandler.

Meanwhile, Realme has been selling in parts of Europe and Latin America, which it described as an important market for the company’s upcoming 12-series handsets.

item.title: Nvidia reveals progress in China’s self-driving chip market, setting up competition with domestic players
item.description:
English Summary:

  • Nvidia obtains several Chinese EV manufacturers as clients for its self-driving system, Drive Thor, including Great Wall Motors, Li Auto, Xiaomi, and Geely-backed ZEEKR.
  • China's automotive chip sector intensifies competition as local players like Huawei and Horizon Robotics challenge Nvidia and other international companies.
  • The Chinese government promotes the development of autonomous vehicles with a market penetration of assisted autonomous driving systems reaching 43% in the first half of 2023.
  • Huawei emerges as a leading competitor, launching its home-grown ADS 2.0 platform and entering a joint venture with Changan Automobile to commercialize its smart car solutions.

中文摘要：

  • 英伟达为其自动驾驶系统 Drive Thor 吸引了多家中国电动车制造商客户，包括长城汽车、理想汽车、小米汽车和吉利控股的极氪汽车。
  • 随着华为、地平线机器人等本土玩家挑战英伟达和其他国际公司，中国车用芯片领域竞争加剧。
  • 中国政府大力推动无人驾驶汽车的发展，2023 年上半年搭载辅助自动驾驶系统的汽车市场渗透率已达到 43%。
  • 华为脱颖而出成为主要竞争对手，推出了自研 ADS 2.0 平台，并与长安汽车合资成立新公司，将智能汽车解决方案推向市场。

Words:

  • navigate-on-autopilot (NOA) - 自动辅助驾驶，一种汽车自动驾驶系统，允许驾驶员在高速公路上脱离方向盘和踏板。
  • semi-autonomous - 半自动的，指汽车能够在某些条件下自动驾驶，但需要驾驶员随时准备接管控制权。

Phrases:

  • self-driving technology - 自动驾驶技术，指汽车能够完全自动驾驶，而无需人工输入。
  • advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) - 高级驾驶辅助系统，指汽车能够在某些条件下自动控制车辆的某些功能，如自动巡航控制、自动泊车等。

Sentences:

  • Nvidia signed up Great Wall Motors, Li Auto, Xiaomi, and Geely-backed ZEEKR for its Drive Thor autonomous driving system, Photo: EPA-EFE - 英伟达为其自动驾驶系统 Drive Thor 吸引了多家中国电动车制造商客户，包括长城汽车、理想汽车、小米汽车和吉利控股的极氪汽车。
  • This sets up increased competition with local self-driving system providers such as Huawei Technologies. - 随着华为、地平线机器人等本土玩家挑战英伟达和其他国际公司，中国车用芯片领域竞争加剧。

Grammar:

  • Drive Thor – which integrates automated and assisted driving, in-vehicle infotainment, and parking in one single system – to its family of automotive system-on-a-chip solutions in September 2022. - Drive Thor集成了自动驾驶、辅助驾驶、车载信息娱乐和停车等功能于一体，并于2022年9月加入英伟达的车载系统级芯片解决方案系列。
  • Thanks to policy stimulus, Chinese autonomous driving system solution providers – including Horizon Robotics and Black Sesame Technologies – have stepped up their game and are set for greater competition with the likes of Nvidia, Qualcomm, and Intel-owned MobileEye in areas such as autonomous driving chips and full-stack smart car solutions. - 得益于政策刺激，以地平线机器人、黑芝麻智能等为代表的中国自动驾驶系统解决方案提供商迅速崛起，并在自动驾驶芯片、全栈智能汽车解决方案等领域与英伟达、高通、英特尔旗下的MobileEye等展开激烈的竞争。
  • Autonomous-driving systems have become a competitive sector as China pushes greater adoption of advanced self-driving technology
  • Nvidia has signed up Great Wall Motors, Li Auto, Xiaomi, and Geely-backed ZEEKR for its Drive Thor autonomous driving system

Nvidia, the US chip maker banned by Washington from selling its most advanced semiconductors to China, has revealed solid progress in the mainland’s electric vehicle (EV) market with its self-driving technology.

Nvidia said at the CES consumer electronics show in Las Vegas that Chinese EV makers, including Great Wall Motors, Li Auto, Xiaomi, and Geely-backed ZEEKR, have snapped up its Drive Thor autonomous driving system to enhance performance of their vehicles. This sets up increased competition with local self-driving system providers such as Huawei Technologies.

Autonomous-driving systems, seen as the brains behind future cars, have become a competitive sector as China pushes greater adoption of advanced self-driving technology. Nvidia added Drive Thor – which integrates automated and assisted driving, in-vehicle infotainment, and parking in one single system – to its family of automotive system-on-a-chip solutions in September 2022.

As of June last year, Nvidia – which is unable to ship its advanced AI chips to China due to US trade sanctions – had about a 52 per cent share of the global navigate-on-autopilot (NOA) market and cooperation agreements with 25 automotive original equipment makers globally, according to data from Gasgoo Institute, a Shanghai-based research company.

“Nvidia remains predominant in terms of smart-driving chips in China,” said Brady Wang, an associate director with research firm Counterpoint. “But competition between Chinese manufacturers and foreign companies is set to intensify as they compete for a slice of the autonomous driving segment in China’s EV market.”

Non-tech Chinese firms tout orders of Nvidia chips, winning stock boosts

Chinese EV makers have been big buyers of Nvidia auto chips. For example, Nio’s flagship sedans ET5 and ES7, Li Auto’s L9 model and Xpeng’s G9 vehicle all come equipped with Nvidia’s Orin chips. Automotive chips are seen as a less sensitive area of the semiconductor market by US authorities when it comes to setting trade sanctions.

In 2022, China sold about 7 million units of smart passenger vehicles equipped with assisted autonomous driving systems, which translates into a market penetration rate of 35 per cent. In the first half of 2023, the market penetration rate rose to almost 43 per cent, according to data from China’s Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT).

The MIIT in November issued a new policy that encourages EV makers to bring vehicles equipped with high-levels of autonomous driving to Chinese roads, in a major effort to accomplish Chinese President Xi Jinping’s vision of building a strong and modern transport network.

Thanks to policy stimulus, Chinese autonomous driving system solution providers – including Horizon Robotics and Black Sesame Technologies – have stepped up their game and are set for greater competition with the likes of Nvidia, Qualcomm, and Intel-owned MobileEye in areas such as autonomous driving chips and full-stack smart car solutions.

Nvidia topped China’s NOA computing solutions market with a share of 53 per cent in the first half of 2023, followed by smart mobility start-up Horizon Robotics with 31 per cent, and Texas Instruments with 9 per cent, according to data from the Gaogong Industry Research Institute (GGII), which tracks nascent industries in China such as EVs and batteries. Huawei and MobileEye ranked in equal 4th place with a 4 per cent market share each.

Huawei has emerged as a leading player due to its experience in auto chip design and hardware systems after it set up a smart car solution unit in 2019, the year it was added to a US trade blacklist. Under these sanctions, Huawei could not buy most US-origin semiconductors and had to rely on its own smart-driving chips.

Priot to the 2023 Shanghai Auto Show in April, Huawei launched its own home-grown smart driving platform, called advanced driving system 2.0 (ADS) and powered by a Huawei-made chipset MDC 610, according to a report by research company Counterpoint and a note in July by Kaiyuan Securities.

In November, Huawei announced it was transferring core technologies from its smart car business into a new joint venture with state-backed Changan Automobile. The new venture, in which Changan has a 40 per cent stake, is open to other car makers as equity investors.

Despite still being in the red, the firm’s car unit achieved sales of 2.1 billion yuan (US$305 million) in 2022 and 1 billion yuan in revenue in the first half of last year, according to company information.

item.title: Apple supplier BOE signs US$9 billion deal to build next-generation display plant in southwestern China
item.description:
English summary：

BOE Technology Group, one of the world's largest display makers, plans to build a 63-billion yuan (US$9 billion) next-generation production complex in Chengdu, capital of southwestern Sichuan province, to meet growing demand for high-end displays used in laptops and tablets. The facility is expected to start mass production by the fourth quarter of 2026, positioning Chengdu as the display industry's largest manufacturing base for advanced flexible panels.
  • Abstract: BOE to establish a new production complex for high-end displays in Chengdu, bolstering China's display manufacturing capacity.
  • Theme: BOE's investment in Chengdu signifies the collaboration between Big Tech companies and local governments, aiming to restore business confidence and drive economic recovery.
  • Viewpoint: The project highlights China's dominance in the global display manufacturing sector, with a projected 72% market share by 2027.
  • Main information: BOE's Gen-8.6 AMOLED production line will produce 32,000 glass substrates monthly, enhancing efficiency, reducing costs and extending lifespan. The global OLED market is estimated to reach US$64 billion in revenue by 2026.

Chinese summary：

京东方科技集团计划在西南四川省会成都市建设一个价值630亿元人民币（90亿美元）的下一代生产中心，以满足对用于笔记本电脑和平板电脑的高端显示屏不断增长的需求。该工厂预计于2026年第四季度开始量产，成都将成为显示行业先进柔性面板最大的制造基地。
  • 摘要：京东方将在成都建立一个新的高端显示屏生产中心，以提高中国的显示屏制造能力。
  • 主题：京东方在成都的投资标志着大型科技公司与地方政府合作，旨在重建商业信心和推动经济复苏。
  • 观点：该项目突出了中国在全球显示屏制造领域的优势，预计到2027年市场份额将达到72%。
  • 主要信息：京东方Gen-8.6 AMOLED生产线将每月生产32,000块玻璃基板，从而提高效率、降低成本并延长使用寿命。全球OLED市场预计在2026年达到640亿美元的收入。

Words：

  • soar (v.) - /sɔːr/ 猛增，飙升。

    原文例句：The deal represents the largest single industrial project in terms of investment in Chengdu, the capital of southwestern Sichuan province.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Middle English，由soren和suren组成，意为“猛烈上升，猛烈升起”，在这个例句中，它指的是尖端显示器在笔记本电脑和平板电脑中使用的高需求导致的飙升。

  • bolster (v.) - /ˈboʊlstər/ 加固，加强。

    原文例句：The deal represents the largest single industrial project in terms of investment in Chengdu, the capital of southwestern Sichuan province.

    例句讲解：这个单词由bolster（垫子）和-er（使……）组成，意为“使更强，使更坚固”。在这个例句中，它表示通过对尖端显示器的投资来加强中国大陆的显示器制造能力。

Phrases：

  • in terms of - 就……而言，从……方面来说。

    原文例句：The deal represents the largest single industrial project in terms of investment in Chengdu, the capital of southwestern Sichuan province.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由in（在……里面），terms（条件，条款）和of（属于，关于）构成的，表示“按照某种标准或角度来衡量或评价”。在这个例句中，它表示对成都的投资而言，这是一个最大的单项工业项目。

Sentences：

  • BOE, which initially announced the project last December, will build its so-called Gen-8.6 AMOLED – for active-matrix organic light-emitting diode – production facility to meet soaring global demand for high-end displays used in laptops and tablets, according to the firm. -京东方去年12月首次宣布了该项目，该公司表示，将建设所谓的Gen-8.6 AMOLED生产设施（用于有源矩阵有机发光二极管），以满足对用于笔记本电脑和平板电脑的高端显示器不断增长的全球需求。

    • 句子分析：这是一个长句，包括一个主句和两个从句。主句是BOE will build its so-called Gen-8.6 AMOLED production facility，其中主语是BOE，谓语是will build，宾语是its so-called Gen-8.6 AMOLED production facility。第一个从句是which initially announced the project last December，其中主语是BOE，谓语是announced，宾语是the project。第二个从句是to meet soaring global demand for high-end displays used in laptops and tablets，其中主语是to meet soaring global demand for high-end displays used in laptops and tablets，谓语是meet，宾语是soaring global demand for high-end displays used in laptops and tablets。这个句子的意思是说，京东方去年12月首次宣布了该项目，该公司表示，将建设所谓的Gen-8.6 AMOLED生产设施（用于有源矩阵有机发光二极管），以满足对用于笔记本电脑和平板电脑的高端显示器不断增长的全球需求。

Grammar：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：BOE Technology Group previously established mainland China’s first sixth-generation, flexible OLED production line.

    语法讲解：这是一种时态，结构是：have/has + been + 过去分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，过去分词是动词的-ed形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，it表示京东方技术集团以前建立了中国大陆的第一条第六代柔性OLED生产线。

  • 被动语态 - 表示动作或状态的承受者。

    原文例句：Construction of the new plant is estimated to take 34 months, according to BOE, and mass production is projected to start by the fourth quarter of 2026.

    语法讲解：被动语态是英语中的一种语态，表示动作或状态的承受者。其结构是：be + 过去分词。其中be要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，过去分词是动词的-ed形式。这种语态通常用于强调动作或状态的承受者，或当动作或状态的执行者不重要或未知时。在这个例句中，construction of the new plant is estimated to take 34 months表示新工厂的建设预计需要34个月，mass production is projected to start by the fourth quarter of 2026表示预计到2026年第四季度开始量产。

  • BOE’s so-called Gen-8.6 AMOLED production complex is expected to meet soaring global demand for high-end displays used in laptops and tablets
  • The deal represents the largest single industrial project in terms of investment in Chengdu, the capital of southwestern Sichuan province

Apple supplier BOE Technology Group, one of the world’s largest display makers, will set up a 63-billion yuan (US$9 billion) next-generation production complex in Chengdu, capital of southwestern Sichuan province, that is expected to bolster mainland China’s lead in display manufacturing capacity over the next few years.

The Chengdu municipal government on Wednesday said in a statement that Beijing-based BOE and the city’s Hi-Tech Industrial Development Zone have signed the contract to build the plant, representing the largest single industrial project in the capital in terms of investment.

BOE, which initially announced the project last December, will build its so-called Gen-8.6 AMOLED – for active-matrix organic light-emitting diode – production facility to meet soaring global demand for high-end displays used in laptops and tablets, according to the firm.

Shares of BOE in Shenzhen closed up 1.07 per cent to 3.76 yuan on Thursday.

The deal underscores efforts by Chinese local governments to increase collaboration with Big Tech companies in the private sector, which is in line with the mainland’s efforts to restore business confidence and drive economic recovery.

The new BOE production facility is expected to position Chengdu as the display industry’s largest manufacturing base for advanced flexible panels.

Construction of the new plant is estimated to take 34 months, according to BOE, and mass production is projected to start by the fourth quarter of 2026. The next-generation plant is designed to produce 32,000 glass substrates – each measuring 2,290 millimetres by 2,620mm – every month.

Apart from accommodating larger substrates, BOE said its Gen-8.6 AMOLED production line will be able to enhance panel-cutting efficiency for mid-size displays, reduce production costs, lower power consumption and achieve an extended lifespan.

OLED displays for mobile and other information technology devices are expected to enjoy rapid expansion between 2022 and 2027, with a compound annual growth rate of 7.3 per cent, according to a recent report by Display Supply Chain Consultants (DSCC).

China is forecast to dominate global display manufacturing capacity, with a 72 per cent market share from 2026 to 2027, the DSCC report said.

How Chinese accountant turned dying factory into No 1 display maker

By comparison, South Korea and Taiwan’s market shares are expected to reach 8 per cent and 17 per cent, respectively, in 2027.

The global OLED market is predicted to generate US$64 billion in revenue in 2026, driven by demand for panels used in laptops, computers monitors and tablets, according to DSCC.
